Package edu.uiowa.cs.warp

Class WorkLoad

java.lang.Object
edu.uiowa.cs.warp.VisualizationObject
edu.uiowa.cs.warp.WorkLoadDescription
edu.uiowa.cs.warp.WorkLoad
All Implemented Interfaces:
ReliabilityParameters
public class WorkLoad
extends WorkLoadDescription
implements ReliabilityParameters

Represents all the flows in a file.

Build the nodes and flows for the workload described in the workload description file, whose name is passed into the Constructor via the parameter inputFileName. Good default values for the constructors are m = 0.9, e2e = 0.99, and numFaults = 1 when the second constructor is used.
Version:
1.4
Author:
sgoddard

    • addFlow

      public void addFlow​(java.lang.String flowName)

      Add a new flow to the Flows dictionary

      If the flow name already exists it will be overwritten with the new one. If any flow name is not an integer, the intForFlowNames will be permanently set to false for this workload.

      Parameters:
      flowName -

    • addNodeToFlow

      public void addNodeToFlow​(java.lang.String flowName, java.lang.String nodeName)

      Adds a node to the given flow.

      If the node already exists in the workload, it will only be added to the flow. Otherwise a new node will be created.

      Parameters:
      flowName - Name of flow to add the node to.
      nodeName - The node that will be added to the flow.

    • getFlowPriority

      public java.lang.Integer getFlowPriority​(java.lang.String flowName, java.lang.String nodeName)

      Returns the priority of the node with nodeName belonging to the flow flowName

      Gets the flow by the flowName then uses an iterator from the flow's nodes to iterate through all the nodes until the node with name nodeName is found. Then that node's priority is returned

      0 is returned if the node or flow is not found.

      Parameters:
      flowName - the name of the flow
      nodeName - the node in the flow
      Returns:
      the priority of nodeName belonging to flowName

      public void setFlowsInPriorityOrder()

      Sorts the workloads flows in priority order.

      public method that takes lists of flows that are unsorted, sorted by priority first, then by sorted by index, and proceeds to make a new Array List that contains the flow names in the order that has been requested.

    • getFixedTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost

      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getFixedTxPerLinkAndTotalTxCost​(Flow flow)

      Returns the fixed tx per link and the total tx cost of the given flow.

      The tx per link is defined as the number of faults allowed plus one since a node has to be used once to transmit a message. The return value is an ArrayList with link num nodes in flow + 1. The last element in the list is the maximum tx in the flow. all previous elements represent the tx per node of a flow and each correspond to node.

      Parameters:
      flow - the flow object to find the tx of.
      Returns:
      an arraylist of integers with each entry corresponding to a node in the flow's tx. The last entry is the maximum tx.

    • numTxAttemptsPerLinkAndTotalTxAttempts

      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> numTxAttemptsPerLinkAndTotalTxAttempts​(Flow flow, java.lang.Double e2e, java.lang.Double M, boolean optimizationRequested)
      private method creates a matrix that displays the reliability of transmitting packets to nodes in an efficient manner using the source and sink of the flow nodes
      Parameters:
      flow - a flow object in which the nodes will be retrieved
      e2e - double to be used to set up matrix for transmission reliability
      M - Double used for computing reliability for source and sink
      optimizationRequested - boolean to verify if an optimization has been requested
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of integers that represents the worst case cost of transmitting e2e

    • getNodeNamesOrderedAlphabetically

      public java.lang.String[] getNodeNamesOrderedAlphabetically()

      Gets the node names in alphabetical order.

      public method that gets the nodes from a node map, and sorts them in alphabetical order. If the names are strings of integers, then there must be an additional step to sort them correctly. If all of the node names are ints, sort them in ascending order, and then convert it to a string.

      Returns:
      a list of strings containing the names of the nodes in alphabetical order.

    • getNodesInFlow

      public java.lang.String[] getNodesInFlow​(java.lang.String flowName)

      Returns the nodes in a flow.

      Loops through a requested flow and obtains the nodes contained in the flow. if not, return an empty array.

      Parameters:
      flowName - the flow in which nodes will be obtained from
      Returns:
      an array of strings containing the nodes obtained from the selected flow.

    • getHyperPeriod

      public java.lang.Integer getHyperPeriod()

      Returns least common multiple of every period.

      public method that obtains the least common multiple of every period, and returns it.

      Returns:
      an Integer hyperPeriod that represents the LCM of every period.

      Returns:
